shut.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: to close something, or to become closed
shut.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: I heard his bedroom door shut.
She lay down on her bed and shut her eyes.
He shut the drawer and turned the key.
She walked quickly in and shut the door behind her.
shut.translation[0].definitions[1].defin: to stop being open to the public for a short time or permanently
shut.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: The post office shuts at 5 o'clock.
At midday we shut the shop for lunch.
He lost his job when they shut the factory.
shut.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: She kept the windows shut, for fear of burglars.
He sat with his eyes shut.
The door slammed shut behind him.
shut.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: if a shop, bar etc is shut, it is not open for business
shut.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: in the evening when the shops are shut
The first four hotels we tried were shut for the winter.
shut.translation[1].note_box[0].sections: He went on sobbing, his eyes tight shut.
The gate swung shut behind her.
He pulled the trapdoor shut over his head.
When it’s so hot, we keep the doors and windows shut and put on the air conditioner.
shut.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: if a company, factory etc shuts or is shut, it stops operating permanently
shut.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: The steel company plans to shut two of its factories.
The airline shut down at midnight on Friday.
Regulators were threatening to shut the bank down.
shut.translation[2].definitions[1].defin: if a shop or business shuts or is shut, it stops operating at the end of the working day or for the weekend etc
shut.translation[2].definitions[1].examp: Do you shut the shop for lunch?
